Query: How do I configure my static DNS in interfaces?

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_766131: How do I set a static IP in Ubuntu?
ul_235264: How to set multicast in /etc/network/interfaces?
au_336849: Can't set DNS with Static IP
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_235264: auto dummy0
iface dummy0 inet static
   address 10.10.0.1
   netmask 255.255.255.0
   post-up ifconfig dummy0 multicast

Explanations about Options.-a:
"All". The -a option is normally equivalent to -v -t ANY. It also affects the
 behaviour of the -l list zone option.
Explanations about Options.-t:
Query type: The type argument can be any recognized query type: CNAME, NS, SOA, TXT,
 DNSKEY, AXFR, etc.

Explanations about Options.-n:
show numerical addresses instead of trying to determine symbolic host names. This
 is useful if you are trying to determine why the route to your nameserver has
 vanished.
